moves.1. c4: The english opening.This is an experiment for me since I never play this opening.
moves.1... c5: The symmetrical variation.also good is 1...Nf6 and 1...e5
moves.13... cxd5: the best response.Ready to contest white on the c-file.
moves.14. Bb2: the bishop will do well on the long diagonal.
moves.14... a6 15. Rc1 Bb7 16. Na4: looking for the outpost on c5.
moves.19. Bd4: still looking at c5,but also looking for the possibility of the knight or bishop on b6.
moves.19... Bf6 20. Bxf6 Nxf6 21. Nc5: the c5 square is know under White's control.
moves.21... Qa8: a passive move,although 21...Bc8 is just as passive.
moves.22. Bf1: abondoning the fianchetto andaiming for the weak a6 pawn.
moves.22... Rd8 23. Bd3: the bishop is pretty strong here because now he also has the b1-h7 diagonal.Also the queen can go to e2 forming a battery on the f1-a6 diagonal.
moves.24. Qe2 Rd6 25. Nxb7: finally trading the knight for the Bishop.in strategic sense this is bad,but White wins a pawn.
moves.25... Qxb7 26. Rc5: the rook joins in the hunt for the a6-pawn.
moves.27... Nc3 28. Qf1 Rc6 29. Bxa6 Qc7 30. B: looking to trade and get my 2 queenside passed pawns to work
! trading queens and getting closer to victory.
moves.33... Qxc5 34. Rxc5 Rxc5: ?? the decisive mistake!Black thought he could win the "Weak" pawns,but they are stronger than they look!
moves.35. bxc5 Ke7 36. a4: The march of the a-pawn will begin!
moves.38... Kc7 39. Kf3: the white king finally joins the battle to stop Black's central majority.
moves.42. f4: ! A strong move!White aims to get rid of the central majority,which will thus win the game!
moves.42... f6 43. f5: ! the finishing touch!Black is in zugzwang soon.43...h5 44.h3!(this is better than 44.h4 as we soon will see.)44...Kc6 45.Kc3 Kc7 (45...e4 46.Kd4 will win.) 46.Kb4 (46.h4!? will do too.) 46...Kc6 47.h4! (this is the difference!Black's king will now be kicked back.) 47...Kc7 48.Kb5 and White will win.
